title: Eccomerce Bot Developer
jobs_text:
"We are looking for somebody who is able to create an automated bot for eccomerce purposes which can include price tracking and (most importantly) auto checkout from price drops. 
 
At the moment, we source mid-competition products and are able to achieve this mainly with manual methods. The products are not the most competitive products out there but will still sell quite quickly. 
 
The budget for the project is just a starting point. It would be great to build a relationship with someone and to get any nessecary updates over time. 
 
It would also be great to get some professional advice on safe using of the bot (avoiding cancellations/suspensions). 
 
The right person is simply someone who knows this area and how to do the job. 
 
When applying, please mention "purple cow" just to show you have read this and it's not an automated copy/paste application. 
 
We can handle payment within Upwork so both parties are protected. 
 
Before starting, it would be great to discuss the project and what is involved (for example: the site in question we want to source from). 
 
Looking for a long term relationship for any releveant future projects as well. 
 
To apply, simply let me know what you think (informally) of the above and any questions. I can give more specifics. 
 
Many thanks 
 
James and Nick"

title: Ecommerce scraping for Nordstrom
jobs_text:
"I'm looking for some help in writing robust scrapers for Nordstrom. 
 
- I'm looking to scrape all products from Nordstrom US. 
- The scraper should be able to bypass each website's anti-scraping protections (if there are any). 
- The scraper should be able to be run daily (if possible, otherwise weekly is fine). If the product's price or availability changes, the changes should be updated in the database. 
- The scraper should be deployed onto EC2. AWS IAM credentials will be provided. 
- The data should be ingested into a Postgres database. The schema for the database will be provided. The credentials for the database will be provided. 
- Choice of language is ideally in TypeScript, but Python or Ruby is fine as well. 
 
Please note, if the scraper is not able to work, there will be no payment. 
 
I repeat, there is no payment if you don't successfully complete a working scraper that can work in production for at least 1 week. Do not pick this job unless you are confident that you can bypass Nordstrom's anti-scraping protections. 
 
Deliverables: 
- Running scraper in EC2 
- Full code for the scraper, including all dependencies and instructions how to use it"

2) You will have to correctly upload all the datafeed product details (including scraped data) onto the shopify store. 
 
3) The youtube video matching the product has to be found and uploaded as well on the respective product page. 
 
As new products become available on the sheet the scraping, product upload needs to be repeated over and over again. 
 
Please note that this is a bulk automation project NOT a manual one-by-one edit and upload. 
 
In your proposal, please explain in detail what is your solution to tackling every single point mentioned above. 
 
If you do not explain your solution and timeline in detail, your proposal may get ignored and not responded. 
 
Thanks, 
 
Hani"

title: Build a comparison tool
jobs_text:
"Parts of this job may require database and indexing skillset.   
View the Comparison Tool 2022 file to see more details about this job. 
 
This job will be broken up into 3 milestones.   
 
Milestone 1: $50 
Write code that edits excel files and reprints the data on 2 new tabs in a vertical format instead of the horizontal way it is now. 
 
Milestone 2: $200 to $250 
Create an app/program that finds all the outputs that are within proximity of each other and present them in a bucketed manner. 
 
Milestone 3: $250 to $450 
Add functionality to the program created in milestone 2.  
Make custom searches available.   
 
I use Excel to manually perform my searches.  You can use whatever you determine is best for this job.   
I need all three milestones complete before Wednesday, February 2nd.  If this work is beyond your skillset and/or you can't complete it by then, please don't apply.   
 
Those who want to be considered for Milestones 2 and 3 need to download the updated Tester File(s) and look at how I perform milestone 3 manually on the results sheet.  This is the process I need automated.  Example 3 is critical in understanding my process.  
Show your competency by creating a report for time block 61, making buckets between 23.270 and 23.320 for group 1 only..  This is a very small area of the potential full range.  Provide what you think buckets should look like for milestone 2 and 3 for the range I just mentioned.  Use a proximity of 0.003 for when a mandatory time is found.  
Send me your results and I'll check to see if you got the right answers.  If you do, then I know I can give you the job. 
 
Here's an overview of the Grid file your program will be working with.   
Typically, Gird files come with about 3.6 Million outputs spread out over 300 Time Blocks.  Each Time Block has about 12,000 outputs.  Each group in a Time Block has about 4,000 outputs. So when your program searches one time block, it searches each group for matches, potentially searching up to 4,000 outputs at a time.    
When the request is to search 3 times block at once, for example, your program would be comparing 12,000 outputs per group.  "

title: Product Page Scraping Bot
jobs_text:
"Our product Trolli is a Chrome extension shopping basket. When a Trolli user is (signed in and Trolli is active) is on a product page Trolli will manually scrape relevant information from the page (The product price etc) and will display this on our widget, giving the user the option to save this item (and the info) in their basket. 
We would like the automate this process, as well as automatically adding new websites to be scraped, as a user visits a new website. 
Objective: 
To scrape from a webpage - Webpage URL, Website name, Product title, Product Image, Product 
Price. 
 
Currently: 
We have a JSON file websites' with a dictionary of websites. 
We manually inspect each webpage and take the classname (and for some cases - for the image the child element) for each relevant div. 
These classnames are manually added to our JSON file which is then called when we run our extension. 
 
url: 'aliexpress.com' 
website: 'aliexpress' 
titleSelectors: ['.product-title'], 
imageSelectors: ['.image-view-magnifier-wrap img'], 
priceSelectors: ['.uniform-banner-box-price'], 
 
On each webpage we run our JS and loop through the 'websites' urls until we have a match with the current location.href 
When we have a match we have a function to getTextElement or getlmageElement by using the 'websites' selectors to querySelector the relevant information. 
 
What we want: 
When Trolli is active and a user is on any web page: 
- To recognise a product page (looking for relevant info - price etc) 
- Automatically scrape the ÜRL, website name (usually from URL), title, image and price from page. 
JSON file to be automatically updated when a previously unknown website is added with the info (above.) 
(We will then integrate this into our function for displaying and saving the info) 
(An automated testing/QA system)"

"I need to download products from amazon.com and wayfair based on a search query:

where `max height` is typically part of the product text description. E.g in this example:   it says ``` transitioning from sitting to standing from 28" to 46". ```` - this means Max Height is 46".  Crude extraction based on matching the quotation marks is ok.  
 
Ideally the script works in google sheets, so that the search keywords can be adjusted, but I would also accept if I need to provide you a list of queries and you send me back CSV or Google sheet files. This is meant to be a quick task."

title: Export Blog Posts from RSS feed to Text Files or WordPress Simple Site
jobs_text:
"I need someone to scrape all the posts from this site: 
 
(link removed)/ 
 
I am the owner of this site and the current host (jigsy) does not offer an export feature for the blog posts.  The website will be deleted on 3/20/22 due to the cancellation of the service. 
 
I want to save my posts.  There are about 350 posts altogether. 
 
I don't care about the images or tags for each post. 
 
I only care about: 
The Title 
The body text of each post. 
 
Option 1: 
 
You extract the text of each post and create a text file for each post. Then deliver all the text files in a zip file. 
 
Option 2: 
 
You extract the text of each post and put them all in one single Google Doc file. 
 
Option 3: 
 
You export each post into a WordPress site, then create a backup of all the posts so I can import it all into a new WordPress site myself. 
 
Option 4: 
 
You export each post into a new WordPress site that I will create and give you access to. 
Once all the posts are into the new WordPress site I will clean them up, add the images, and tags, etc. 
 
I'm looking for options. If you have any other suggestions please feel free to let me know. 
 
Eventually, all these blog posts have to be transferred to a new site in some way. 
 
I just don't have the time to do them all right now and my last resort will be to copy/paste each post individually and get to this when I have time. 
"

title: asyncio Python Retail Price Scraper
jobs_text:
"I am looking for a simple scraper built using python, asyncio and stores to an SQLite database using a specific provided database schema.  
 
The retail site is a fast fashion retailer. The goal is to extract prices, titles and other fields from a specific section.  
 
The end deliverable is the scraper code itself functioning as outlined above. I expect the crawler to be built in a modular and re-usable fashion. 
 
To apply please share your scraping experience. And also your knowledge of asyncio or willingness to use asyncio for this project. Thank you for your time."

Image, Brand, Size, Color, Link to Amazon, Buy Box, Buy Box: 90 days avg., Buy Box: Min, Buy Box: Max and Category 
              c) We also will introduce more information, the most important there will be the "Status" and can be "Approved" or "Denied" 
 
2) The Second file = "Approved" 
This file will be a filter with a query, only "Approved" products from the Databes file will be displayed. 
On this file, we will introduce 2 new columns, the most important will be "Client" (from a list) 
 
3) The third file = "Shopping List - Client 1 and 2" // "Shopping List - Client 3 and 4""

"
